title: Oil prices surge 15% after attack on Saudi facility hits global supply
text:
Oil prices surge 15% after attack on Saudi facility hits global supply

Commodities 1 hour ago (Sep 15, 2019 18:20)

© Reuters. Oil prices surge 15% after attack on Saudi facility hits global supply NEW YORK, Sept 15 (Reuters) - Oil prices surged more than 15% at the open on Sunday after an attack on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities on Saturday that knocked out more than 5% of global oil supply. futures jumped more than 19% to a session high of $71.95 a barrel at the opening, while futures surged more than 15% to a session high of $63.34 a barrel. State oil giant Saudi Aramco said the attack cut output by 5.7 million barrels per day, at a time when Aramco is trying to ready itself for what is expected to be the world's largest share sale. gave no timeline for output resumption. A source close to the matter told Reuters the return to full oil capacity could take "weeks, not days."
